trans-unit.source: SUM is an aggregate function that evaluates the sum of the expression over a set of rows.

seg-source.mrk: SUM is an aggregate function that evaluates the sum of the expression over a set of rows.

target.mrk: SUM is an aggregate function that evaluates the sum of the expression over a set of rows.

trans-unit.source: See <xref href="rrefsqlj33923.dita#rrefsqlj33923"></xref> for more information about these functions.

seg-source.mrk: See <xref href="rrefsqlj33923.dita#rrefsqlj33923"></xref> for more information about these functions.

target.mrk: See <xref href="rrefsqlj33923.dita#rrefsqlj33923"></xref> for more information about these functions.

trans-unit.source: SUM is allowed only on expressions that evaluate to numeric data types.

seg-source.mrk: SUM is allowed only on expressions that evaluate to numeric data types.

target.mrk: SUM is allowed only on expressions that evaluate to numeric data types.

trans-unit.source: The DISTINCT and ALL qualifiers eliminate or retain duplicates. ALL is assumed if neither ALL nor DISTINCT is specified. For example, if a column contains the values 1, 1, 1, 1, and 2, SUM(col) returns a greater value than SUM(DISTINCT col).

seg-source.mrk: The DISTINCT and ALL qualifiers eliminate or retain duplicates.
ALL is assumed if neither ALL nor DISTINCT is specified.
For example, if a column contains the values 1, 1, 1, 1, and 2, SUM(col) returns a greater value than SUM(DISTINCT col).

target.mrk: The DISTINCT and ALL qualifiers eliminate or retain duplicates.
ALL is assumed if neither ALL nor DISTINCT is specified.
For example, if a column contains the values 1, 1, 1, 1, and 2, SUM(col) returns a greater value than SUM(DISTINCT col).

trans-unit.source: Only one DISTINCT aggregate expression per selectExpression is allowed. For example, the following query is not allowed:

seg-source.mrk: Only one DISTINCT aggregate expression per selectExpression is allowed.
For example, the following query is not allowed:

target.mrk: Only one DISTINCT aggregate expression per selectExpression is allowed.
For example, the following query is not allowed:

trans-unit.source: SELECT AVG (DISTINCT flying_time), SUM (DISTINCT miles) FROM Flights

seg-source.mrk: SELECT AVG (DISTINCT flying_time), SUM (DISTINCT miles) FROM Flights

target.mrk: SELECT AVG (DISTINCT flying_time), SUM (DISTINCT miles) FROM Flights

trans-unit.source: The expression can contain multiple column references or expressions, but it cannot contain another aggregate or subquery. It must evaluate to a built-in numeric data type. If an expression evaluates to NULL, the aggregate skips that value.

seg-source.mrk: The expression can contain multiple column references or expressions, but it cannot contain another aggregate or subquery.
It must evaluate to a built-in numeric data type.
If an expression evaluates to NULL, the aggregate skips that value.

target.mrk: The expression can contain multiple column references or expressions, but it cannot contain another aggregate or subquery.
It must evaluate to a built-in numeric data type.
If an expression evaluates to NULL, the aggregate skips that value.

trans-unit.source: The resulting data type is the same as the expression on which it operates (it might overflow).

seg-source.mrk: The resulting data type is the same as the expression on which it operates (it might overflow).

target.mrk: The resulting data type is the same as the expression on which it operates (it might overflow).

trans-unit.source: -- find all economy seats available: SELECT SUM (economy_seats) FROM Airlines; -- use SUM on multiple column references -- (find the total number of all seats purchased): SELECT SUM (economy_seats_taken + business_seats_taken + firstclass_seats_taken) as seats_taken FROM FLIGHTAVAILABILITY;

seg-source.mrk: -- find all economy seats available: SELECT SUM (economy_seats) FROM Airlines; -- use SUM on multiple column references -- (find the total number of all seats purchased): SELECT SUM (economy_seats_taken + business_seats_taken + firstclass_seats_taken) as seats_taken FROM FLIGHTAVAILABILITY;

target.mrk: -- find all economy seats available: SELECT SUM (economy_seats) FROM Airlines; -- use SUM on multiple column references -- (find the total number of all seats purchased): SELECT SUM (economy_seats_taken + business_seats_taken + firstclass_seats_taken) as seats_taken FROM FLIGHTAVAILABILITY;
